   19: %%
   20: -module(timer_SUITE).
   21: 
   22: -export([all/0, suite/0,groups/0,init_per_suite/1, end_per_suite/1, init_per_group/2,end_per_group/2]).
   23: -export([do_big_test/1]).
   24: -export([big_test/1, collect/3, i_t/3, a_t/2]).
   25: -export([do_nrev/1, internal_watchdog/2]).
   26: 
   27: -include_lib("common_test/include/ct.hrl").
   28: 
   29: %% Random test of the timer module. This is a really nasty test, as it
   30: %% runs a lot of timeouts and then checks in the end if any of them
   31: %% was triggered too early or if any late timeouts was much too late.
   32: %%
   33: %% Running time on average is about 90 seconds.
   34: 
   35: %% The main test case in this module is "do_big_test", which
   36: %% orders a large number of timeouts and measures how
   37: %% exact the timeouts arrives. To simulate a system under load there is
   38: %% also a number of other concurrent processes running "nrev" at the same
   39: %% time. The result is analyzed afterwards by trying to check if the
   40: %% measured values are reasonable. It is hard to determine what is
   41: %% reasonable on different machines; therefore the test can sometimes
   42: %% fail, even though the timer module is ok.
   43: 
   44: suite() ->
   45:     [{ct_hooks,[ts_install_cth]},
   46:      {timetrap,{minutes,20}}].
   47: 
   48: all() -> 
   49:     [do_big_test].
   50: 
   51: groups() -> 
   52:     [].
   53: 
   54: init_per_suite(Config) ->
   55:     Config.
   56: 
   57: end_per_suite(_Config) ->
   58:     ok.
   59: 
   60: init_per_group(_GroupName, Config) ->
   61:     Config.
   62: 
   63: end_per_group(_GroupName, Config) ->
   64:     Config.
   65: 
   66: 
   67: %% ------------------------------------------------------- %%
   68: 
   69: do_big_test(TConfig) when is_list(TConfig) ->
   70:     Save = process_flag(trap_exit, true),
   71:     Result = big_test(200),
   72:     process_flag(trap_exit, Save),
   73:     report_result(Result).
   74: 
   75: report_result(ok) -> ok;
   76: report_result(Error) -> ct:fail(Error).
   77: 
   78: %% ------------------------------------------------------- %%
   79: 
   80: big_test(N) ->
   81:     C = start_collect(),
   82:     system_time(), system_time(), system_time(),
   83: 
   84:     big_loop(C, N, []),
   85: 
   86:     %%C ! print_report,
   87:     C ! {self(), get_report},
   88:     Report = receive
   89: 		 {report, R} ->
   90: 		     R
   91: 	     end,
   92:     C ! stop,
   93:     receive
   94: 	{'EXIT', C, normal} ->
   95: 	    ok
   96:     end,
   97:     print_report(Report),
   98:     Result = analyze_report(Report),
   99:     %%io:format("big_test is done: ~w~n", [Result]),
  100:     Result.
  101: 
  102: big_loop(_C, 0, []) ->
  103:     %%io:format("All processes are done!~n", []),
  104:     ok;
  105: big_loop(C, 0, Pids) ->
  106:     %%ok = io:format("Loop done, ~w processes remaining~n", [length(Pids)]),
  107:     %% wait for remaining processes
  108:     receive
  109: 	{'EXIT', Pid, done} ->
  110: 	    big_loop(C, 0, lists:delete(Pid, Pids));
  111: 	{'EXIT', Pid, Error} ->
  112: 	    ok = io:format("XXX Pid ~w died with reason ~p~n",
  113: 			   [Pid, Error]),
  114: 	    big_loop(C, 0, lists:delete(Pid, Pids))
  115:     end;
  116: big_loop(C, N, Pids) ->
  117:     %% First reap any processes that are done.
  118:     receive
  119: 	{'EXIT', Pid, done} ->
  120: 	    big_loop(C, N, lists:delete(Pid, Pids));
  121: 	{'EXIT', Pid, Error} ->
  122: 	    ok =io:format("XXX Internal error: Pid ~w died, reason ~p~n",
  123: 			  [Pid, Error]),
  124: 	    big_loop(C, N, lists:delete(Pid, Pids))
  125:     after 0 ->
  126: 
  127: 	    %% maybe start an interval timer test
  128: 	    Pids1 = maybe_start_i_test(Pids, C, rand:uniform(4)),
  129: 
  130: 	    %% start 1-4 "after" tests
  131: 	    Pids2 = start_after_test(Pids1, C, rand:uniform(4)),
  132: 	    %%Pids2=Pids1,
  133: 
  134: 	    %% wait a little while
  135: 	    ok = timer:sleep(rand:uniform(200)*3),
  136: 
  137: 	    %% spawn zero, one or two nrev to get some load ;-/
  138: 	    Pids3 = start_nrev(Pids2, rand:uniform(100)),
  139: 
  140: 	    big_loop(C, N-1, Pids3)
  141:     end.
  142: 
  143: 
  144: start_nrev(Pids, N) when N < 25 ->
  145:     Pids;
  146: start_nrev(Pids, N) when N < 75 ->
  147:     [spawn_link(timer_SUITE, do_nrev, [1])|Pids];
  148: start_nrev(Pids, _N) ->
  149:     NrevPid1 = spawn_link(timer_SUITE, do_nrev, [rand:uniform(1000)*10]),
  150:     NrevPid2 = spawn_link(timer_SUITE, do_nrev, [1]),
  151:     [NrevPid1,NrevPid2|Pids].
  152: 
  153: 
  154: start_after_test(Pids, C, 1) ->
  155:     TO1 = rand:uniform(100)*47,
  156:     [s_a_t(C, TO1)|Pids];
  157: start_after_test(Pids, C, 2) ->
  158:     TO1 = rand:uniform(100)*47,
  159:     TO2 = TO1 div rand:uniform(3) + 101,
  160:     [s_a_t(C, TO1),s_a_t(C, TO2)|Pids];
  161: start_after_test(Pids, C, N) ->
  162:     TO1 = rand:uniform(100)*47,
  163:     start_after_test([s_a_t(C, TO1)|Pids], C, N-1).
  164: 
  165: s_a_t(C, TimeOut) ->
  166:     spawn_link(timer_SUITE, a_t, [C, TimeOut]).
  167: 
  168: a_t(C, TimeOut) ->
  169:     start_watchdog(self(), TimeOut),
  170:     Start = system_time(),
  171:     {ok, _} = timer:send_after(TimeOut, self(), now),
  172:     receive
  173: 	now ->
  174: 	    Stop = system_time(),
  175: 	    report(C, Start,Stop,TimeOut),
  176: 	    exit(done);
  177: 	watchdog ->
  178: 	    Stop = system_time(),
  179: 	    report(C, Start,Stop,TimeOut),
  180: 	    ok = io:format("Internal watchdog timeout (a), not good!!~n",
  181: 			   []),
  182: 	    exit(done)
  183:     end.
  184: 
  185: 
  186: maybe_start_i_test(Pids, C, 1) ->
  187:     %% ok do it
  188:     TOI = rand:uniform(53)*49,
  189:     CountI = rand:uniform(10) + 3,		% at least 4 times
  190:     [spawn_link(timer_SUITE, i_t, [C, TOI, CountI])|Pids];
  191: maybe_start_i_test(Pids, _C, _) ->
  192:     Pids.
  193: 
  194: i_t(C, TimeOut, Times) ->
  195:     start_watchdog(self(), TimeOut*Times),
  196:     Start = system_time(),
  197:     {ok, Ref} = timer:send_interval(TimeOut, interval),
  198:     i_wait(Start, Start, 1, TimeOut, Times, Ref, C).
  199: 
  200: i_wait(Start, Prev, Times, TimeOut, Times, Ref, C) ->
  201:     receive
  202: 	interval ->
  203: 	    Now = system_time(),
  204: 	    report_interval(C, {final,Times}, Start, Prev, Now, TimeOut),
  205: 	    {ok, cancel} = timer:cancel(Ref),
  206: 	    exit(done);
  207: 	watchdog ->
  208: 	    Now = system_time(),
  209: 	    report_interval(C, {final,Times}, Start, Prev, Now, TimeOut),
  210: 	    {ok, cancel} = timer:cancel(Ref),
  211: 	    ok = io:format("Internal watchdog timeout (i), not good!!~n",
  212: 			   []),
  213: 	    exit(done)
  214:     end;
  215: i_wait(Start, Prev, Count, TimeOut, Times, Ref, C) ->
  216:     receive
  217: 	interval ->
  218: 	    Now = system_time(),
  219: 	    report_interval(C, Count, Start, Prev, Now, TimeOut),
  220: 	    i_wait(Start, Now, Count+1, TimeOut, Times, Ref, C);
  221: 	watchdog ->
  222: 	    Now = system_time(),
  223: 	    report_interval(C, {final,Count}, Start, Prev, Now, TimeOut),
  224: 	    ok = io:format("Internal watchdog timeout (j), not good!!~n",
  225: 			   []),
  226: 	    exit(done)
  227:     end.
  228: 
  229: report(C, Start, Stop, Time) ->
  230:     C ! {a_sample, Start, Stop, Time}.
  231: report_interval(C, Count, Start, Prev, Now, TimeOut) ->
  232:     C ! {i_sample, Count, Start, Prev, Now, TimeOut}.
  233: 
  234: %% ------------------------------------------------------- %%
  235: 
  236: %% internal watchdog
  237: start_watchdog(Pid, TimeOut) ->
  238:     spawn_link(timer_SUITE, internal_watchdog, [Pid, 3*TimeOut+1000]).
  239: 
  240: internal_watchdog(Pid, TimeOut) ->
  241:     receive
  242:     after TimeOut ->
  243: 	    Pid ! watchdog,
  244: 	    exit(normal)
  245:     end.
  246: 
  247: %% ------------------------------------------------------- %%
  248: 
  249: -record(stat, {n=0,max=0,min=min,avg=0}).
  250: 
  251: start_collect() ->
  252:     spawn_link(timer_SUITE, collect, [0,{0,new_update(),new_update()},[]]).
  253: 
  254: collect(N, {E,A,B}, I) ->
  255:     receive
  256: 	{a_sample, Start, Stop, Time} when Stop - Start > Time ->
  257: 	    collect(N+1, {E,update(Stop-Start-Time,A),B}, I);
  258: 	{a_sample, Start, Stop, Time} when Stop - Start < Time ->
  259: 	    collect(N+1, {E,A,update(Time-Stop+Start,B)}, I);
  260: 	{a_sample, _Start, _Stop, _Time} ->
  261: 	    collect(N+1, {E+1,A,B}, I);
  262: 	{i_sample, {final,Count}, Start, Prev, Now, TimeOut} ->
  263: 	    IntervDiff = Now - Prev - TimeOut,
  264: 	    Drift = Now - (Count*TimeOut) - Start,
  265: 	    collect(N, {E,A,B}, [{{final,Count},IntervDiff,Drift}|I]);
  266: 	{i_sample, Count, Start, Prev, Now, TimeOut} ->
  267: 	    IntervDiff = Now - Prev - TimeOut,
  268: 	    Drift = Now - (Count*TimeOut) - Start,
  269: 	    collect(N, {E,A,B}, [{Count,IntervDiff,Drift}|I]);
  270: 	print_report ->
  271: 	    print_report({E,A,B,I}),
  272: 	    collect(N,{E,A,B}, I);
  273: 	{Pid, get_report} when is_pid(Pid) ->
  274: 	    Pid ! {report, {E, A, B, I}},
  275: 	    collect(N,{E,A,B}, I);
  276: 	reset ->
  277: 	    collect(0, {0,new_update(),new_update()}, []);
  278: 	stop ->
  279: 	    exit(normal);
  280: 	_Other ->
  281: 	    collect(N, {E,A,B}, I)
  282:     end.
  283: 
  284: new_update() -> #stat{}.
  285: update(New, Stat) when New > Stat#stat.max ->
  286:     Stat#stat{n=Stat#stat.n + 1, max=New, avg=(New+Stat#stat.avg) div 2};
  287: update(New, Stat) when New < Stat#stat.min ->
  288:     Stat#stat{n=Stat#stat.n + 1, min=New, avg=(New+Stat#stat.avg) div 2};
  289: update(New, Stat) ->
  290:     Stat#stat{n=Stat#stat.n + 1, avg=(New+Stat#stat.avg) div 2}.
  291: 
  292: print_report({E,LateS,EarlyS,I}) ->
  293:     Early = EarlyS#stat.n, Late = LateS#stat.n,
  294:     Total = E + Early + Late,
  295:     io:format("~nOn total of ~w timeouts, there were ~w exact, ~w "
  296: 	      "late and ~w early.~n", [Total, E, Late, Early]),
  297:     io:format("Late stats (N,Max,Min,Avg): ~w~nEarly stats: ~w~n",
  298: 	      [LateS, EarlyS]),
  299:     IntervS = collect_interval_final_stats(I),
  300:     io:format("Interval stats (Max,Min,Avg): ~w~n", [IntervS]),
  301:     ok.
  302: 
  303: collect_interval_final_stats(I) ->
  304:     collect_interval_final_stats(I, 0, min, 0).
  305: collect_interval_final_stats([], Max, Min, Avg) ->
  306:     {Max, Min, Avg};
  307: collect_interval_final_stats([{{final,_Count},_,Dev}|T], Max, Min, Avg) ->
  308:     NMax = if Dev>Max -> Dev; true -> Max end,
  309:     NMin = if Dev<Min -> Dev; true -> Min end,
  310:     collect_interval_final_stats(T, NMax, NMin, (Dev+Avg) div 2);
  311: collect_interval_final_stats([_|T], Max, Min, Avg) ->
  312:     collect_interval_final_stats(T, Max, Min, Avg).
  313: 
  314: analyze_report({E,LateS,EarlyS,I}) ->
  315:     Early = EarlyS#stat.n, Late = LateS#stat.n,
  316:     IntervS = collect_interval_final_stats(I),
  317:     Res1 = min_and_early_check(E, Early, Late, element(2,IntervS)),
  318:     Res2 = abnormal_max_check(LateS#stat.max, element(1,IntervS)),
  319:     res_combine(ok, [Res1, Res2]).
  320: 
  321: -define(ok_i_min, -100).
  322: -define(ok_max, 8000).
  323: -define(ok_i_max, 4000).
  324: 
  325: %% ok as long as Early == 0 and IntervMin >= ok_interv_min
  326: min_and_early_check(_Exact, 0, _Late, IntervMin) when IntervMin >= ?ok_i_min ->
  327:     ok;
  328: min_and_early_check(_Exact, Early, _Late, IntervMin) when IntervMin >= ?ok_i_min ->
  329:     {error, {early_timeouts, Early}};
  330: min_and_early_check(_Exact, 0, _Late, _IntervMin) ->
  331:     {error, early_interval_timeout};
  332: min_and_early_check(_Exact, Early, _Late, _IntervMin) ->
  333:     {error, [{early_timeouts, Early},{error, early_interval_timeout}]}.
  334: 
  335: abnormal_max_check(LateMax, IntMax) when LateMax < ?ok_max,
  336:                                          IntMax < ?ok_i_max ->
  337:     ok;
  338: abnormal_max_check(LateMax, IntMax) when IntMax < ?ok_i_max ->
  339:     {error, {big_late_max, LateMax}};
  340: abnormal_max_check(LateMax, IntMax) when LateMax < ?ok_max ->
  341:     {error, {big_interval_max, IntMax}};
  342: abnormal_max_check(LateMax, IntMax) ->
  343:     {error, [{big_late_max, LateMax},{big_interval_max, IntMax}]}.
  344: 
  345: res_combine(Res, []) ->
  346:     Res;
  347: res_combine(Res, [ok|T]) ->
  348:     res_combine(Res, T);
  349: res_combine(ok, [{error,What}|T]) ->
  350:     res_combine({error,What}, T);
  351: res_combine({error,Es}, [{error,E}|T]) ->
  352:     res_combine({error,lists:flatten([E,Es])}, T).
  353: 
  354: 
  355: system_time() ->
  356:     erlang:monotonic_time(millisecond).
  357: 
  358: %% ------------------------------------------------------- %%
  359: 
  360: do_nrev(Sleep) ->
  361:     ok = timer:sleep(Sleep),
  362:     test(1000,"abcdefghijklmnopqrstuvxyz1234"),
  363:     exit(done).
  364: 
  365: test(0,_) ->
  366:     true;
  367: test(N,L) ->
  368:     nrev(L),
  369:     test(N - 1, L).
  370: 
  371: nrev([]) ->
  372:     [];
  373: nrev([H|T]) ->
  374:     append(nrev(T), [H]).
  375: 
  376: append([H|T],Z) ->
  377:     [H|append(T,Z)];
  378: append([],X) ->
  379:     X.
  380: 
  381: %% ------------------------------------------------------- %%
